ca.ualberta.cmput301f14t16.easya.Model

Class Topic

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cmput301f14t16.easya.Model.Content
      • ca.ualberta.cmput301f14t16.easya.Model.Topic
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Answer, Question

    public abstract class Topic
extends Content
    Topic extends Content, providing added functionality to suit more specific purposes. This class adds methods for storing and accessing a list of Reply objects, as well as a single picture. It also provides methods to tally the total number of upvotes it has been given by users of the application.
    Author:
    Brett Commandeur, Cauani

    • Field Detail

      • picture

        private PixelBitmap picture
        A picture attached to the Topic object.

      • replies

        private java.util.List<Reply> replies
        A list of replies created by users in response to the Topic.

      • favourites

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> favourites
        A list of User IDs who have marked this Topic as a favorite.

      • upVotes

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> upVotes
        A list of User IDs who have upvoted this topic. One User may add at most one upvote to any given Topic, so a single User will appear at most once in this list. Therefore, the length of this list is the number of unique users who have upvoted this Topic, and so, the total number of upvotes recieved by this Topic.

        public Topic(java.lang.String body,
             java.lang.String userId)
        Creates a new instance of Topic containing the body text provided, and associated with the given author ID. Content#date and Content.id will be automatically generated.
        Parameters:
        body - String stored by the new instance of Topic. Setter for Content.body
        authorId - Unique identifier for author of Topic. Setter for Content#authorID

        public void setUpvote(java.lang.String userId)

      • setFavourite

        public void setFavourite(User user)
        Checks if the User submitted is already in favourites. If they are, it removes them from the list. Otherwise, it adds them to it.

      • checkFavourite

        public boolean checkFavourite(User user)
        Parameters:
        user -
        Returns:
        True if the provided User has marked the Topic as a favourite (the User is found in favourites.

      • checkUpVote

        public boolean checkUpVote(User user)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
